com.swopteam07.tablr.UI

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component
      • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Container<T>
        • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.DrawableContainer<com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.TableRow>
          • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Table
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>

    public class Table
extends DrawableContainer<com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.TableRow>
    A class representing a table. A table consists of a collection of rows.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(int x,
             int y,
             boolean visible,
             int columnWidth,
             int rowHeight,
             java.lang.String[] headers,
             int[] columnIds,
             Component parent)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new table with the given dimensions, visibility state and headers.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        visible - The visibility state of the new component.
        headers - The headers for each column in the table.
        columnWidth - The default width of a cell.
        rowHeight - The default height of a row.
        columnIds - The ids to be used for the cells in each row.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Effects:
      • The table is initialized as a drawable component with the given parameters.
            super(x, y, 2 * rowHeight, 0, visible, parent)
      • The new object contains all the headers.
            setHeaders(headers, columnIds)

      • Table

        public Table(int x,
             int y,
             int columnWidth,
             int rowHeight,
             java.lang.String[] headers,
             int[] columnIds,
             Component parent)
        Create a new visible table with the given dimensions and headers.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the component relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        y - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the component.relative to the parent component if it exists or the window if it doesn't.
        headers - The headers for each column in the table.
        columnWidth - The default width of a cell.
        rowHeight - The default height of a row.
        columnIds - The ids to be used for the cells in each row.
        parent - The component that contains this component or null if this component has no parent.
        Effect:
        The table is initialized with the given parameters.
            this(x, y, true, columnWidth, rowHeight, headers, columnIds, parent)

        public java.lang.String getHeaderAt(int index)
        Get the table's nth column header.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to get the header for.
        Returns:
        The header for the given column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - | index < 0 || index >= getNbColumns()

      • hasAsHeader

        public boolean hasAsHeader(java.lang.String header)
        Check if this table contains a specific header.
        Parameters:
        header - The header to check for.
        Returns:
        True if the headers of this table contain the given header.
            result = (
              for some I in 0..(getNbHeaders() - 1)
                  getHeaderAt(I) == header
            )

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(java.lang.String[] headers,
                       int[] ids)
        Set the new headers of the columns in this table.
        Parameters:
        headers - The headers to add to the column.
        ids - The ids to be used for the columns corresponding to each of the headers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the sizes of both arguments are not equal.

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(java.lang.String[] headers)
        Set the new headers of the columns in this table.
        Parameters:
        headers - The headers to add to the column.
        Effect:
        Calls the setHeaders(headers, cellIds) method with the cellIds a list of ints from [0,headers.size() - 1]

      • setColumnWidth

        public void setColumnWidth(java.lang.String header,
                           int width)
        Set the width for the column corresponding to the given header.
        Parameters:
        header - The header for which to set the width.
        width - The width of the column corresponding to the given header.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the table does not contain a row identified by the header. |!hasAsHeader(header)
        Postcondition:
        The new width for the header is equal to the given width.
            new.getColumnWidth(header) == width

      • setColumnWidths

        public void setColumnWidths(int[] widths)
        Set the widths of all the columns in this table.
        Parameters:
        widths - The new widths of the columns in this table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when the length of the widths array doesn't correspond to the number of columns. | widths.length != getHeaders().size()

      • getColumnWidths

        public int[] getColumnWidths()
        Returns:
        A list containing the width of each column in this table.
